square.obstacle

Class MultiObstacle

  • java.lang.Object
    • square.obstacle.MultiObstacle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Obstacle
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LightTrail, Wall

    public abstract class MultiObstacle
extends java.lang.Object
implements Obstacle
    Super class where any obstacle covering multiple squares inherits its general properties from. Such as a wall or a light trail A player cannot move through an obstacle.
    Author:
    Dieter Castel, Jonas Devlieghere, Vincent Reniers and Stefan Pante

      Returns a list of squares which the obstacle covers.
      boolean isValidSquare(Square square)
      Check whether the given square can be added to this obstacle.
      void removeSquare(Square square)
      Removes a square of the obstacle.
      protected boolean squaresPointBack()
      Since a multiObstacle is implemented bi-directionally this method should always hold which means every square points back to it's proper obstacle.

      • isValidSquare

        public boolean isValidSquare(Square square)
        Check whether the given square can be added to this obstacle. The added square may not already be contained in the existing obstacle. No duplicates may be added.
        Specified by:
        isValidSquare in interface Obstacle
        Parameters:
        square - The square to be checked
        Returns:
        True if and only if the square is connected to one of the squares. False If the square is a duplicate or it is not connected to any other square.

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Get the current length of the obstacle.

        protected boolean squaresPointBack()
        Since a multiObstacle is implemented bi-directionally this method should always hold which means every square points back to it's proper obstacle.
